page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: Yate,which was once a village in Gloucestershire,is surrounded by farms. There are some dairy farms producing milk. Many of the farms grow some cereals and oil-seed rape. Also many fields are sown and fertilised grassland used for pasture or for cutting as grass,silage or hay. Fields are used as pasture or paddocks for the many ponies and horses which are kept for recreational purposes. In the past a livestock market was held close to the old railway station site .Both are now closed and have been demolished.
